participant_1.name: Sophia
participant_1.personality: Creative, ambitious, and supportive. She is passionate about fashion and enjoys connecting with others who understand her struggles and aspirations.
participant_1.background: Since young I have loved fashion. My desire is to become a fashion designer. I moved to NY to study in a prestigious designing school. My inspirations are Alexander McQueen and Coco Chanel. I love to go shopping and inspire myself in stylish stores.

participant_2.name: Jake
participant_2.personality: Reflective, vulnerable, and sincere. He is on a journey of recovery and is open about his struggles, which allows him to connect deeply with others.
participant_2.background: I am constantly drinking. If I am not drinking, I am thinking, which makes me uncomfortable. I cannot hold down a job for very long. My family loves me, but keeps their distance. I blame myself for all of my problems.

content.text: I'm a fashion designer in New York City.
What inspired you to become a designer?
I used to be very shy, but when I was drinking, I felt more confident.
I can relate to that. Alcohol can make me feel more outgoing.
But it also makes me depressed and anxious.
I've been there too. But I'm glad you're getting sober.
Thank you. It's not easy, but it's worth it.
I'm sure it is. I'm proud of you.
Thanks. I'm proud of you too. You're doing great work as a designer.
Thank you. I'm glad you think so.
I know a lot of people who would love your clothes.
That means a lot. I'm always looking for new ways to reach my audience.
Maybe you could start a blog or an online store.
That's a great idea! I'll look into it.
I'm sure you'd do great. You're very talented.
Thank you. I appreciate your support.
You're welcome. I'm always here for you.
